name: Revise Robotics
headline: AI-enabled robots that refurbish hundreds of laptops a day
description:
E-waste recycling facilities spend most of their time and effort sifting through discarded electronics, searching for valuable devices, refurbishing them, and reselling them in second-hand markets.

Our first product is an AI-enabled robotic system that integrates with these facilities to assess and refurbish hundreds of laptops a day without any human intervention. The system tests laptops, wipes their hard drives, photographs them, and posts them on online marketplaces for resale, regardless of model, manufacturer, or operating system.

founders.name: Rupesh Jeyaram, Founder
founders.description: Building AI-enabled robotic systems to refurbish and resell used electronic devices, starting with laptops. Wharton '24, Caltech '20

# Accelerating electronics refurbishment
## through **robotics** and **AI**.
#### We're building modular systems for inspecting, refurbishing, and reselling discarded devices. 
[Subscribe to our Newsletter](https://www.reviserobotics.com/<http:/eepurl.com/iUmGaw>)
### 60+ million tons of electronics are thrown away each year.
There is over $50B in residual value locked within these discarded electronics, containing critical materials essential for future technology. By refurbishing, reusing, and responsibly recycling these devices, we can reduce e-waste, lower the demand for newly mined materials, and minimize the environmental footprint of electronic consumption, fostering a more sustainable and equitable future.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672924e8f1a65361f0d64c12/672b7b80c2e2b60f8424c77e_shutterstock_2229789155%20copy.jpeg)
##### Product
### We want to take stacks of mixed laptops and prepare them for resale.
Entirely with robots. 
Launching Fall 2025.
##### Newsletter

generated_description:
Revise Robotics is tackling one of the pressing issues of our age: the massive amounts of electronic waste generated each year. Founded in 2024 and part of Y Combinator's Batch W25, Revise Robotics has its sights set on revolutionizing the e-waste recycling industry with smart automation. Their mission? To create AI-enabled robots capable of refurbishing hundreds of laptops daily—completely autonomously.

Initially starting as an e-waste recycling facility, the team at Revise Robotics noticed the inefficiencies in manually sifting through discarded electronics. They’ve transitioned into developing a cutting-edge robotic system that seamlessly integrates with these facilities. Here's the kicker: their flagship product is designed to assess, wipe, photograph, and list laptops for resale on online marketplaces without any human touch. This means they can handle any model or manufacturer, making the refurbishment process not only efficient but also scalable.

With a lean team of just three located in their headquarters, the company is spearheaded by innovative leaders, including Garry Tan as their Group Partner. The heart of Revise Robotics’ approach lies in repurposing what's often deemed worthless—60 million tons of electronics thrown away each year—to extract over $50 billion in residual value. By refurbishing and recycling, they're helping to minimize the demand for newly mined materials and reduce the environmental footprint of electronic consumption.

Scheduled to launch in Fall 2025, their vision is clear: to take mixed stacks of laptops and turn them into high-quality refurbished products completely through robotic processes. It's not just about business; it’s a step towards a more sustainable future in technology.

For more information, or to stay updated on their progress, you can check their website at [Revise Robotics](https://www.reviserobotics.com/) or follow them on their LinkedIn page. This is a company that's not just thinking about the present but is also laying groundwork for a more equitable and environmentally-friendly tech landscape.
